name: RioTable
tagline: A new HTML tag you can use to render html tables from a JSON data, using Riot.js library
body: # RioTable # RioTable (Riot+Table) Is a flexible HTML component to generate tables with [riot.js lib](https://github.com/muut/riotjs) from a JSON source > (sources and samples very soon) !!! ![](img/rtable2.png) You can use this **HTML tag **in your common html files ### The simplest sample ### ```html ``` This is a simple definition of one table that renders **all** JSON data returned by the callback function getJSON. Of course we can retrieve JSON data from an AJAX method ```javascript function getJSON(){ return [ {id:101, city:'New York', flag:'ny.png'}, {id:202, city:'Berlin', flag:'be.png'}, {id:205, city:'Madrid', flag:'md.png'} ] } ``` **Result:** ![](img/rtable1.png) ### The columns ### We can specify which columns to render from JSON data ```html ``` **Result:** ![](img/rtable3.png) ### Some basic options ### Setting an id or a CSS class (for example to render table as BootStrap table), and the width of any column is so simple: ```html ``` ### Formating data ### It's very common to include our custom HTML tags inside our rendered cell like bold text, links, images, html snippets ... As easy as: ```html {id} {city} ``` **Result:** ![](img/rtable2.png) ### Calling RioTable Methods ### For example we can add new data to our table when a button is clicked. ```html ```
